title.narrative: INCLUSIVE AND QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid), Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, have increased access to equitable and inclusive quality education opportunities leading to development, improved learning outcomes and skills for life and work.

related-activity.ref: 2850/A0/06/882 QUALITY EDUCATION AND SKILLS FOR LIFE AND WORK

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: UNICEF Mexico continued its efforts towards inclusive, quality education focusing on ensuring access to education during school closures, setting conditions for a safe return to school; strengthening of foundational skills for those left behind during the prolonged school closures and for those children who already presented learning gaps before the COVID 19 crisis, namely indigenous children; as well as longer term solutions for inclusive education for children on the move. 14,555 children on the move benefited from WASH and education interventions in shelters. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/01/2022
